result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley M Levandoski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Stipulation and Order to Modify Sentence

8:46 a.m. Defendant Bradley M Levandoski in court with attorney Ann Renc for Atty Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. W/H Sentence, Probation w/conditions.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

ADA Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc concurs with joint recommendation. If revoked, 5 days credit. 

BY THE COURT:***PROBATION****
I/S Sentence, 30 days Jail w/huber 5 days credit - stayed
12 mo  Probation
Conditions:
No contact with Adam Chronquist or his residence.
Apology letter to be given to Agent first.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
Pay costs and DNA surcharge.

BY THE COURT:
